name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner v. Russell William SCIANNA, Sr., Respondent
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Scianna

parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner v. Russell William SCIANNA, Sr., Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 20th day of April, 2004, there having been filed with this Court by Russell William Scianna, Sr., his verified Statement of Resignation dated March 4, 2004, stating that he desires to resign from the Bar of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in accordance with the provisions of Rule 215, Pa.R.D.E., it is
ORDERED that the resignation of Russell William Scianna, Sr., be and it is hereby accepted and he is DISBARRED ON CONSENT from the Bar of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania; and it is further ORDERED that he shall comply with the provisions of Rule 217, Pa.R.D.E. Respondent shall pay costs, if any, to the Disciplinary Board pursuant to Rule 208(g), Pa.R.D.E.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
847 A.2d 672
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner v. Russell William SCIANNA, Sr., Respondent.
No. 916 Disciplinary Docket No. 3.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 20, 2004.
